This situation has been further aggravated by the
extraordinary increase in the rates of Central Excise
Duty (CED) of the order of 140% and 390% respectively
on regular and micro-sized non-filter cigarettes with
effect from March 2008. This hike in rates, coming on
the heels of a 30% equivalent increase in tax incidence
due to the levy of VAT in April 2007, has forced the
organised cigarette industry to substantially vacate this
